summary: TLC is an American girl group formed in 1990 in Atlanta, Georgia. The most famous members were Tionne "T-Boz" Watkins, Lisa "Left Eye" Lopes, and Rozonda "Chilli" Thomas. They were very popular in the 1990s, with nine top-ten songs and four number-one hits. Their album *CrazySexyCool* was a big success. TLC has sold over 65 million records and won many awards, including four Grammys. After Lopes' death in 2002, they continued as a duo and released more music. In 2022, they were honored at the Black Music & Entertainment Walk of Fame.
title: TLC (group)
